thread.title: Consecutive wrecks bring out red flags during Daytona Xfinity race
thread.title_full: Consecutive wrecks bring out red flags during Daytona Xfinity race

author: Ron Clements (us-editorial@performgroup.com)
title: Consecutive wrecks bring out red flags during Daytona Xfinity race
text:
February 25, 2017 5:14pm EST February 25, 2017 5:12pm EST Motorsport, News, English, NASCAR After Tyler Reddick got turned by Scott Lagasse Jr. on turn 3 of the 23rd lap, another massive wreck occurred six laps later. Justin Allgaier (Getty Images) 
Updated at 5:14 p.m. ET 
Updated at 5:14 p.m. ET 
The first NASCAR Xfinity Series race of the year is taking longer than expected. 
Massive wrecks on the 23rd and 29th lap of Saturday's season-opening Powershares QQQ 300 at Daytona International Speedway brought out consecutive red flags to delay the race as the carnage was cleared. 
The first wreck occurred when Tyler Reddick got turned by Scott Lagasse Jr. going into turn 3. #NASCARreplay : Here's another look at what brought us to red flag conditions. #NASCARonFS1 pic.twitter.com/CaoBRd2eO3 â€” NASCAR XFINITY (@NASCAR_XFINITY) February 25, 2017 
The race was delayed for nearly 20 minutes as clean-up crews cleared the track. 
After a full restart on the 27th lap, it didn't take long for the red flag came out again as Daniel Hemric bumped Justin Allgaier, sending Allgaier hard into the wall. The wreck also took out Darrel Wallace Jr., defending Xfinity Series champion Daniel Suarez, Erik Jones and Brandon Jones, among others.
